Class SeatingAvailabilityController

java.lang.Object
dbLogic.restaurantDB.SeatingAvailabilityController
public class SeatingAvailabilityController extends Object
Provides capacity-based availability checks for immediate seating. Determines whether adding new guests would conflict with future reservations or guests already notified from the waiting list.

    static boolean
    canSeatWithFutureReservations(int incomingGuests, LocalDateTime now)
    Determines whether incoming guests can be seated immediately without exceeding the restaurant's total capacity, taking into account active reservations and notified waiting list entries within the next 2 hours.

    Retrieves the total number of guests from ACTIVE reservations, guests waiting at the restaurant, and notified waiting list entries within a specific time window.

  • Method Details

    • canSeatWithFutureReservations

      public static boolean canSeatWithFutureReservations(int incomingGuests, LocalDateTime now)
      Determines whether incoming guests can be seated immediately without exceeding the restaurant's total capacity, taking into account active reservations and notified waiting list entries within the next 2 hours.
      Parameters:
      incomingGuests - Number of guests attempting to enter now.
      now - The current timestamp.
      Returns:
      true if there is enough capacity to seat the guests, false otherwise.

    • getFutureReservedGuests

      public static int getFutureReservedGuests(LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end)
      Retrieves the total number of guests from ACTIVE reservations, guests waiting at the restaurant, and notified waiting list entries within a specific time window.
      Parameters:
      start - The start of the time window (usually 'now').
      end - The end of the time window (usually 'now' + 2 hours).
      Returns:
      The aggregated total number of guests expected to occupy seats.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If a database error occurs during the query.
